column4: anyone got time to help an ubuntu noob with a desktop problem?
ok, open a terminal and type `killall nautilus`
yes, this will happen.  then, in that same terminal, run nautilus again.  (this way, you can see any errors it outputs.)
you should get your desktop back.
did it give you back your prompt or is it hanging?
did it open a file window at least?
ok, just to be sure, try nautilus -q
well, nautilus -q should hang for a minute, but it should spit you back at your prompt after that...
yikes, that's strange.  i'd check #gnome about it, or post a bug report on bugzilla.ubuntu.org
well, i don't think that'll work (because that's what i had you do :), but it's worth a shot.
